speaker: Josh
text: Emma, do you think it’s worth attempting to learn multiple frameworks at once?
ipa: ˈɛmə | du jʊ θɪŋk ɪts wɝθ əˈtɛmptɪŋ tə lɝn ˈmʌltəpəl ˈfɹeɪmˌwɝks æt wʌns
stress: EMMA | do YOU THINK it’s WORTH ATTEMPTING to LEARN MULTIPLE FRAMEWORKS at ONCE
linking:
"worth attempting" → /wɝθ əˈtɛmptɪŋ/ (th + a linking)
"attempting to" → /əˈtɛmptɪŋ tə/ (ng + t linking)

speaker: Emma
text: Honestly, I advise focusing on one at a time. Trying to master everything at once just ends up involving a lot of confusion.
ipa: ˈɑnəstli | aɪ ædˈvaɪz ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ ɑn wʌn æt ə taɪm | ˈtraɪɪŋ tə ˈmæstɚ ˈɛvɹiθɪŋ æt wʌns ʤəst ɛndz ʌp ɪnˈvɑlvɪŋ ə lɑt əv kənˈfjuʒən
stress: HONESTLY | I ADVISE FOCUSING on ONE at a TIME | TRYING to MASTER EVERYTHING at ONCE just ENDS UP INVOLVING a LOT of CONFUSION
linking:
"focusing on" → /ˈfoʊkəsɪŋ ɑn/ (ng + o linking)
"ends up" → /ɛndz ʌp/ (z + u linking)

speaker: Josh
text: Yeah, I considered learning React, Vue, and Angular all together, but maybe that’s too much.
ipa: jæ | aɪ kənˈsɪdɚd ˈlɝnɪŋ ɹiˈækt | vju | ænd ˈæŋɡjələr ɔl təˈɡɛðɚ | bət ˈmeɪbi ðæts tu mʌʧ
stress: YEAH | I CONSIDERED LEARNING REACT, VUE, and ANGULAR all TOGETHER | but MAYBE that’s TOO MUCH
linking:
"learning React" → /ˈlɝnɪŋ ɹiˈækt/ (ng + r linking)
"all together" → /ɔl təˈɡɛðɚ/ (l + t linking)

speaker: Emma
text: Exactly. You should choose to specialize at first. Later, when you're confident, you can go on expanding your stack.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ju ʃəd ʧuz tə ˈspɛʃəˌlaɪz æt fɝst | ˈleɪtɚ | wɛn jʊɹ ˈkɑnfɪdənt | ju kən ɡoʊ ɑn ɪkˈspændɪŋ jʊɹ stæk
stress: EXACTLY | You SHOULD CHOOSE to SPECIALIZE at FIRST | LATER, when you're CONFIDENT, you can GO ON EXPANDING your STACK
linking:
"choose to" → /ʧuz tə/ (z + t linking)
"go on" → /ɡoʊ ɑn/ (w + o linking)

speaker: Josh
text: Got it. Also, do you approve of taking online certifications, or do you think experience matters more?
ipa: ɡɑt ɪt | ˈɔlsoʊ | du jʊ əˈpɹuv əv ˈteɪkɪŋ ˈɑnˌlaɪn ˌsɝtɪfɪˈkeɪʃənz | ɔɹ du jʊ θɪŋk ɪkˈspɪɹiəns ˈmætɚz mɔɹ
stress: GOT IT | ALSO, do YOU APPROVE of TAKING ONLINE CERTIFICATIONS | or do YOU THINK EXPERIENCE MATTERS MORE
linking:
"approve of" → /əˈpɹuv əv/ (v + o linking)
"taking online" → /ˈteɪkɪŋ ˈɑnˌlaɪn/ (ng + o linking)

speaker: Emma
text: I approve of getting certifications — they tend to open doors, especially for juniors. But I always recommend building real-world projects too.
ipa: aɪ əˈpɹuv əv ˈɡɛtɪŋ ˌsɝtɪfɪˈkeɪʃənz — ðeɪ tɛnd tə ˈoʊpən dɔɹz | əˈspɛʃəli fɔɹ ˈʤunjɚz | bət aɪ ˈɔlweɪz ˌrɛkəˈmɛnd ˈbɪldɪŋ ˈɹiəl wɝld ˈpɹɑʤɛkts tu
stress: I APPROVE of GETTING CERTIFICATIONS — they TEND to OPEN DOORS, especially for JUNIORS | But I ALWAYS RECOMMEND BUILDING REAL-WORLD PROJECTS too
linking:
"approve of" → /əˈpɹuv əv/ (v + o linking)
"building real-world" → /ˈbɪldɪŋ ˈɹiəl wɝld/ (ng + r linking)

speaker: Josh
text: Thanks! By the way, my manager reminded me to update my GitHub portfolio this week.
ipa: θæŋks | baɪ ðə weɪ | maɪ ˈmænɪʤɚ ɹɪˈmaɪndɪd mi tə ˈʌpˌdeɪt maɪ ˈɡɪtˌhʌb pɔɹtˈfoʊlioʊ ðɪs wik
stress: THANKS | BY THE WAY, my MANAGER REMINDED me to UPDATE my GITHUB PORTFOLIO this WEEK
linking:
"reminded me" → /ɹɪˈmaɪndɪd mi/ (d + m linking)
"update my" → /ˈʌpˌdeɪt maɪ/ (t + m linking)

speaker: Emma
text: Good! Don't put off uploading your best code. Recruiters tend to check portfolios before even bothering to schedule interviews.
ipa: ɡʊd | doʊnt pʊt ɔf ˈʌpˌloʊdɪŋ jʊɹ bɛst koʊd | ɹɪˈkɹutɚz tɛnd tə ʧɛk pɔɹtˈfoʊlioʊz bɪˈfɔɹ ˈivɪn ˈbɑðɚɪŋ tə ˈskɛʤuəl ˈɪntɚˌvjuz
stress: GOOD | DON'T PUT OFF UPLOADING your BEST CODE | RECRUITERS TEND to CHECK PORTFOLIOS BEFORE even BOTHERING to SCHEDULE INTERVIEWS
linking:
"put off" → /pʊt ɔf/ (t + o linking)
"check portfolios" → /ʧɛk pɔɹtˈfoʊlioʊz/ (k + p linking)

speaker: Josh
text: I'll keep that in mind. I feel like trying to build something new this weekend.
ipa: aɪl kip ðæt ɪn maɪnd | aɪ fil laɪk ˈtraɪɪŋ tə bɪld ˈsʌmθɪŋ nu ðɪs ˈwikˌɛnd
stress: I'LL KEEP that in MIND | I FEEL like TRYING to BUILD SOMETHING NEW this WEEKEND
linking:
"trying to" → /ˈtraɪɪŋ tə/ (ng + t linking)
"build something" → /bɪld ˈsʌmθɪŋ/ (d + s linking)

speaker: Emma
text: That’s the spirit! I can't help feeling excited when juniors are this motivated.
ipa: ðæts ðə ˈspɪɹɪt | aɪ kænt hɛlp ˈfiːlɪŋ ɪkˈsaɪtɪd wɛn ˈʤuːnjɚz ɑɹ ðɪs ˈmoʊtəˌveɪtɪd
stress: THAT’S the SPIRIT | I CAN'T HELP FEELING EXCITED when JUNIORS are this MOTIVATED
linking:

"help feeling" → /hɛlp ˈfiːlɪŋ/ (p + f linking)
"feeling excited" → /ˈfiːlɪŋ ɪkˈsaɪtɪd/ (ng + e linking)

speaker: Josh
text: Haha, well, I’ll do my best. Sometimes I need to ask for help though.
ipa: ˈhɑːhɑː | wɛl | aɪl du maɪ bɛst | ˈsʌmˌtaɪmz aɪ niːd tə æsk fɚ hɛlp ðoʊ
stress: HAHA | WELL | I’LL DO MY BEST | SOMETIMES I NEED to ASK for HELP though
linking:

"ask for" → /æsk fɚ/ (k + f linking)

speaker: Emma
text: Of course! Everyone does. I was made to rely on teammates so many times early in my career.
ipa: əv kɔɹs | ˈɛvɹiˌwʌn dʌz | aɪ wəz meɪd tə ɹɪˈlaɪ ɑn ˈtiːmmeɪts səʊ ˈmɛni taɪmz ˈɝːli ɪn maɪ kəˈɹɪɹ
stress: OF COURSE | EVERYONE DOES | I WAS MADE to RELY on TEAMMATES so MANY TIMES EARLY in MY CAREER
linking:

"rely on" → /ɹɪˈlaɪ ɑn/ (y + o linking)
"so many" → /səʊ ˈmɛni/ (smooth link)

speaker: Josh
text: Really? You seem like you always knew everything!
ipa: ˈɹɪəli | ju sim laɪk ju ˈɔlweɪz nu ˈɛvɹiθɪŋ
stress: REALLY? You SEEM like you ALWAYS KNEW EVERYTHING
linking:

"knew everything" → /nu ˈɛvɹiθɪŋ/ (w + e smooth link)

speaker: Emma
text: Trust me, I remember struggling a lot. But you have to keep going — that's how you grow.
ipa: tɹʌst mi | aɪ ɹɪˈmɛmbɚ ˈstɹʌɡəlɪŋ ə lɑt | bət ju hæv tə kip ˈɡoʊɪŋ — ðæts haʊ ju ɡɹoʊ
stress: TRUST ME | I REMEMBER STRUGGLING a LOT | But YOU HAVE to KEEP GOING — THAT’S HOW YOU GROW
linking:
